sources.title: Ghosts of Hanley House
sources.description: Low-budget Haunted House Horror Movie about 5 people who spend the night at old house where two people were murdererd. Its a little amateurish, but is fairly creepy and even a little scary.

sources.title: Ghosts of Hanley House (1968) RARE CREEPY HORROR
sources.description:
It's FRIGHT NIGHT @PizzaFLIX 
Writer/Director: Louise Sherrill
Stars: Leonard Shoemaker, Barbara Chase, Wilkie de Martel, and Elsie Baker
Would you spend the night in a creepy old house with a few strangers at a chance to win a new '68 Ferrari? Perhaps, the real ghost here is the enigmatic Louise Sherrill. After directing this chilling, low-budget Gothic horror, she disappeared and vanished from cinema history.

1968 was a banner year for Horror, marked by the one-two punch of Roman Polanski's Rosemary's Baby and George Romero's Night of the Living Dead. This forgotten woman-directed entry surely deserves a place in the genre book of Screams.

One of the few female directors working in horror during the 1960s, Sherrill took on multiple roles in this atmospheric film, serving as director, screenwriter, and producer. Her bold vision helped shape this eerie tale of a haunted mansion and the dark secrets lurking within.

Filmed in Austin, Texas, the movie blends classic haunted-house tropes with a minimalist style that heightens suspense and psychological tension. Despite its ultra-low budget and regional production, the film has gained a cult following for its raw, dreamlike quality and pioneering role in women-led horror cinema.

Whether you're a horror aficionado, a fan of vintage independent films, or a researcher of early female filmmakers, this video is a must-watch. Discover the legacy of Louise Sherrill and her contribution to horror storytelling.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: Five people bet they can spend the night in the said-haunted Hanley house. Things get dicey when some eerie manifestations occur. Icy hands that choke, cars that won't start, and every path through the woods lead back to the house.
metadata.Actors: Elsie Baker, Barbara Chase, Wilkie de Martel
